searchableContent.snippet: Solo exhibition exploring death and mortality through conversations and interviews at National Gallery of Iceland, Reykjavík.

searchableContent.title: Þyrlulending (Helicopter Landing)
searchableContent.content: Þyrlulending Helicopter Landing conceptual work time-based sculpture anticipation mechanical intervention sikorsky helicopter Coast Guard negative space positive space materializing immaterial void absence aviation technology place documentation temporal progression venice biennale iceland mixed media magnús pálsson 1976
searchableContent.snippet: Time-based conceptual sculpture measuring anticipation and mechanical intervention through plaster casts of negative space between helicopter wheels and ground.

searchableContent.title: Bestu stykkin
searchableContent.content: Bestu stykkin frúöld cloth figures debut solo exhibition ásmundarsalur dieter roth ironic titles empty skins anti-art provocation public reaction ugly idiotic destruction concrete SÚM vatnsstígur living art museum magnús pálsson 1965 1967
searchableContent.snippet: Three surviving sculptures from a larger anti-art series of cloth figures called Frúöld, featuring ironic titles suggested by Dieter Roth.

searchableContent.title: Viðtöl um dauðann

searchableContent.snippet: A profound exploration of death and mortality through conversations and interviews, exhibited at National Gallery of Iceland.

searchableContent.title: Bestu stykkin
